meanings.definition: Catch or trap in or as if in a snare.
meanings.sent1: The spider insnares insects in its web to eat.
meanings.sent2: The hunter insnares rabbits with clever traps.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat insnares its tail in a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: Her captivating smile insnares the hearts of many admirers.
meanings.sent5: The insnares of love can be both thrilling and dangerous.

meanings.definition: Entangle or involve in difficulties or complicated circumstances.
meanings.sent1: Careless mistakes can insnares us in trouble.
meanings.sent2: The intricate plot insnares the characters in a web of lies.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy insnares itself in a tangle of cords.
meanings.sent4: Procrastination insnares us in a cycle of unfinished tasks.
meanings.sent5: The insnares of bureaucracy can slow down progress.
